results.title: Bonds and relationships. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country education Project-Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A panel led by Peter Couchman, (Don Edgar, Institute of Family Affairs Jenni Strauss and Dr. Christopher Worth, Monash University and Colin Goodwin of Philip Institute) discuss the HSC literature theme which concentrates on the family and the connections which operate within families. In Part 1 the texts “Father and son” by Edmund Gosse and “Long day’s journey into night” by Eugene O’Neill are considered. Covers such topics as the changing mix of families, the stress of being oneself in a family relationship and yet still being part of a family, and the kinds of support available for people facing problems. Part 2 looks at more contemporary issues that affect family relationships. The texts “The Millstone” by Margaret Drabble and “A Very easy death” by Simone de Beauvoir are considered.

results.title: Dinner at the Homesick Restaurant [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland, Country Education Project and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry leads a discussion with Val Kent of Huntingdale Technical School and Dr. Alan Diknot of Monash University to provide some explanations of the puzzling aspects of Anne Tyler’s novel. The program discusses why the novel opens with Pearl’s death; our sympathy for Pearl and for Beck; the effect of their upbringing on the children; and the role of the subsidiary characters.

results.title: The Plague [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Barry Washington, Richard McRoberts and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: A program which provides an analysis of the novel “The Plague” by Albert Camus, some comments on symbolism found in it and some stimulus for further discussion. Discusses the life and philosophy of Camus with reference to the novel; various subject levels of the novel; narrative structure and characters.

results.title: Getting the job: personal experiences with selection panels
results.creator_credit: Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education. Film, Television and Audio Unit
results.brief_description: Focuses on the strategies women employ in order to maximise their chances in job applications. 1. Getting the job. Details the strategies that can be used in job applications as well as techniques to help ensure a successful interview. Women who have been successful in obtaining positions talk about their experiences in applying for jobs. 2 Personal Experiences with Selection Panels. Several women who have been successful in obtaining positions within the Ministry of Education give advice on their experiences in applying for jobs.

results.title: Lord of the flies [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Dennis O’Hearn of Melbourne University discusses what Golding is doing in his novel “Lord of the Flies”, how he goes about it, how successful he is, and using key passages from the book, helps students to see the text in its proper perspective.

results.title: Between cultures
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman explores human relationships between cultures and the struggle to obtain cultural identity. The theme is gradually unfolded through interviews with Morag Loh, co-author of “The Immigrants” and discussion with people personally involved with the struggle between cultures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project

results.title: Sons and lovers 'the dark forest' [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Terry Monagle and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Terry Monagle leads a discussion with a group of students in a program designed to aid understanding of the main characters of D H Lawrence’s novel in the context of the themes which concerned Lawrence in the writing of the novel.

results.title: Our pandas
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A look at the pandas Fei Fei and Xiao Xiao during their visit to their visit to the Melbourne Zoo in 1988. The program includes interviews with their Australian and Chinese keepers.

results.title: Life and study at the university
results.brief_description: Ilustrates aspects of university life: getting a degree, studying, campus club, religious organizations, political groups, learning to think and be analytical and making friends. It concludes showing a number of famous students who choose careers completely different from those for which they studied.
